page.title: 10CUSTOMS
page.content: The main annual festival is the Headon Well Dressing. It is held on St.Peters' Day and the following week (the end of June). Pictures are made on the well by pressing flower petals into clay. The main petals used are ones that will last, such as Hydrangea and Sweet William. Moss is also used as are evergreens. The well dressing was started in 1981 to raise money for the church. It was also hoped that the festival would stop the well being filled in and wrecked. It succeeded. Another main festival is the flower festival that is held in Headon Church. Christmas Carols are sung every year and the local school choir (Bramcote) occasionally sing in the church.Other local customs include Bonfire Night, Halloween, Harvest and First Footing.
